Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Function

abbrev putnam_1996_a6_solution : ℝ → Set (ℝ → ℝ) := sorry
-- (fun c : ℝ => if c ≤ 1 / 4 then {f : ℝ → ℝ | ∃ d : ℝ, ∀ x : ℝ, f x = d} else {f : ℝ → ℝ | ContinuousOn f (Set.Icc 0 c) ∧ f 0 = f c ∧ (∀ x > 0, f x = f (x ^ 2 + c)) ∧ (∀ x < 0, f x = f (-x))})
/--
Let $c>0$ be a constant. Give a complete description, with proof, of the set of all continuous functions $f:\mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ such that $f(x)=f(x^2+c)$ for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$.
-/
theorem putnam_1996_a6
(c : ℝ)
(f : ℝ → ℝ)
(cgt0 : c > 0)
: (Continuous f ∧ ∀ x : ℝ, f x = f (x ^ 2 + c)) ↔ f ∈ putnam_1996_a6_solution c :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1996_a6
(c : ℝ)
(f : ℝ → ℝ)
(cgt0 : c > 0)
: (Continuous f ∧ ∀ x : ℝ, f x = f (x ^ 2 + c)) ↔ f ∈ putnam_1996_a6_solution c := by
  simp only [putnam_1996_a6_solution, Set.mem_setOf_eq]
  constructor
  · rintro ⟨hf, h⟩
    by_cases hc : c ≤ 1 / 4
    · exact ⟨by aesop, by aesop⟩
    · exact ⟨by aesop, by aesop, by aesop, by aesop⟩
  · rintro (⟨hc, h⟩ | ⟨hc, h⟩) <;>
    (try aesop) <;>
    (try simp_all [hc]) <;>
    (try aesop) <;>
    (try
      exact ⟨by aesop, by aesop⟩) <;>
    (try
      exact ⟨by aesop, by aesop⟩)
```

abbrev putnam_1996_a6_solution : ℝ → Set (ℝ → ℝ) := sorry
-- (fun c : ℝ => if c ≤ 1 / 4 then {f : ℝ → ℝ | ∃ d : ℝ, ∀ x : ℝ, f x = d} else {f : ℝ → ℝ | ContinuousOn f (Set.Icc 0 c) ∧ f 0 = f c ∧ (∀ x > 0, f x = f (x ^ 2 + c)) ∧ (∀ x < 0, f x = f (-x))})
/--
Let $c>0$ be a constant. Give a complete description, with proof, of the set of all continuous functions $f:\mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ such that $f(x)=f(x^2+c)$ for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$.
-/
theorem putnam_1996_a6
(c : ℝ)
(f : ℝ → ℝ)

: (Continuous f ∧ ∀ x : ℝ, f x = f (x ^ 2 + c)) ↔ f ∈ putnam_1996_a6_solution c :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1996_a6
(c : ℝ)
(f : ℝ → ℝ)
(cgt0 : c > 0)
: (Continuous f ∧ ∀ x : ℝ, f x = f (x ^ 2 + c)) ↔ f ∈ putnam_1996_a6_solution c := by
  simp [putnam_1996_a6_solution, Set.mem_setOf_eq, Set.mem_setOf_eq]
  <;>
  constructor
  <;>
  intro h
  <;>
  (try simp_all)
  <;>
  (try
    (
      have h₁ := h.2 0
      have h₂ := h.2 (-1)
      have h₃ := h.2 1
      have h₄ := h.2 (-2)
      have h₅ := h.2 (Real.sqrt 3)
      have h₆ := h.2 (-Real.sqrt 3)
      norm_num [sq] at *
      <;>
      nlinarith [Real.sqrt_nonneg 3, Real.sq_sqrt (show (0 : ℝ) ≤ 3 by norm_num)]
    )
  )
  <;>
  (try
    (
      have h₁ := h.1
      have h₂ := h.2
      have h₃ := h.2 0
      have h₄ := h.2 (-1)
      have h₅ := h.2 1
      have h₆ := h.2 (-2)
      have h₇ := h.2 (Real.sqrt 3)
      have h₈ := h.2 (-Real.sqrt 3)
      norm_num [sq] at *
      <;>
      nlinarith [Real.sqrt_nonneg 3, Real.sq_sqrt (show (0 : ℝ) ≤ 3 by norm_num)]
    )
  )
```

theorem putnam_1996_a6
(c : ℝ)
(f : ℝ → ℝ)
(cgt0 : c > 0)
: (Continuous f ∧ ∀ x : ℝ, f x = f (x ^ 2 + c)) ↔ f ∈ putnam_1996_a6_solution c := by
  simp [putnam_1996_a6_solution, Set.mem_setOf_eq, Set.mem_setOf_eq]
  <;>
  constructor
  <;>
  intro h
  <;>
  (try cases' h with h₁ h₂)
  <;>
  (try constructor)
  <;>
  (try simp_all)
  <;>
  (try aesop)
  <;>
  (try
    (
      have h₃ := h₂ 0
      have h₄ := h₂ 1
      have h₅ := h₂ (-1)
      have h₆ := h₂ c
      have h₇ := h₂ (-c)
      have h₈ := h₂ (c + 1)
      have h₉ := h₂ (-c + 1)
      have h₁₀ := h₂ (c - 1)
      have h₁₁ := h₂ (-c - 1)
      norm_num at *
      <;>
      nlinarith
    )
  )
  <;>
  (try
    (
      have h₃ := h₂ 0
      have h₄ := h₂ 1
      have h₅ := h₂ (-1)

open Function

abbrev putnam_1996_a6_solution : ℝ → Set (ℝ → ℝ) := sorry
-- (fun c : ℝ => if c ≤ 1 / 4 then {f : ℝ → ℝ | ∃ d : ℝ, ∀ x : ℝ, f x = d} else {f : ℝ → ℝ | ContinuousOn f (Set.Icc 0 c) ∧ f 0 = f c ∧ (∀ x > 0, f x = f (x ^ 2 + c)) ∧ (∀ x < 0, f x = f (-x))})
/--
Let $c>0$ be a constant. Give a complete description, with proof, of the set of all continuous functions $f:\mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ such that $f(x)=f(x^2+c)$ for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$.
-/

(c : ℝ)
(f : ℝ → ℝ)
(cgt0 : c > 0)
: (Continuous f ∧ ∀ x : ℝ, f x = f (x ^ 2 + c)) ↔ f ∈ putnam_1996_a6_solution c :=
